title: Box office of sci-fi films, TV series surges in China
content:
A delegate of the sci-fi blockbuster "The Wandering Earth" receives the Golden Seagull Awards at the awarding ceremony of the 2019 Qingdao International Film and Television Expo in east China's Shandong Province, Aug. 28, 2019.  (Xinhua/Li Ziheng)
A recent report shows that China's sci-fi film industry is thriving with domestic sci-fi movies and TV dramas contributing more to the whole industry's output value. 
SHENZHEN, Nov. 4 (Xinhua) -- China's sci-fi film industry surged to 17.2 billion yuan (2.4 billion U.S. dollars) in output value in the first half of 2019, according to a report made public Sunday.
The report, issued by the Shenzhen-based Southern University of Science and Technology and China Research Institute for Science Popularization, said sci-fi film industry in China raked in 20.9 billion yuan last year, including 3.37 billion yuan from domestic works.
China-made movies contributed 6.86 billion yuan to the total sci-fi box office in the first half of 2019, accounting for nearly 40 percent of the whole industry's output value.
In terms of TV dramas, 27 sci-fi online dramas were staged in 2018, with a total of 23.47 billion views and an estimated value of 3 billion yuan.
